definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
my (you etc) old father/polite appellation for an elderly male
Chinese name for Sichote-Alin mountain range in Russia's Primorsky Krai around Vladivostok
see 老天爺|老天爷[lao3 tian1 ye2]

sentences.english: It is risky to drive that old car around.
sentences.chinese: 開着那臺老爺車四處跑還挺危險的。

sentences.english: Xu master know that very angry after the second day go to teach them.
sentences.chinese: 徐老爺得知後很生氣欲第二天去去教訓他們。

sentences.english: But Mr. Lea's being good enough to let them keep dragging on around here.
sentences.chinese: 但是李老爺讓他們在這裏苟延殘喘已經夠好心了。

sentences.english: But Grandpa did not want to work at Soba restaurant anymore.
sentences.chinese: 不過老爺爺不想再在蕎麥麪館工作了。

sentences.english: We worked in an almost exclusively, indeed aggressively, masculine environment.
sentences.chinese: 我們所工作的環境中幾乎只有強悍的大老爺們。

sentences.english: A lord regarded as immature or insignificant.
sentences.chinese: 這位老爺爺很小的時候就入了村塾。

sentences.english: The results, along with the master went up into the mountain to uncle et al found the bandits jubilation.
sentences.chinese: 結果，王福隨着舅老爺上山才發現土匪山上一片歡騰。

sentences.english: At my house I'm the lord and master.
sentences.chinese: 我在家裏可是一品大老爺。

sentences.english: For the first time that afternoon the Don behaved coolly.
sentences.chinese: 這是老爺子整個下午第一次表現的冷酷。

sentences.english: I was taught to respect the dignity of the office from childhood.
sentences.chinese: 從小我就被教育要尊重官老爺。

sentences.english: The old man was wandering on the streets selling sugarcoated haws on sticks.
sentences.chinese: 賣冰糖葫蘆的老爺爺走街串巷地叫賣。

sentences.english: The master sub- eyebrows a wrinkly, some impatient Nu minds.
sentences.chinese: 老爺子眉頭一皺，有些不耐煩的怒意。

sentences.english: Do you remember the old man we both know near the town?
sentences.chinese: 你是否還記得我們都認識的在鎮上的那個老爺爺？

sentences.english: A grandfather's preserved corpse lies in his family home years after his death.
sentences.chinese: 一個老爺爺的屍體在死後仍然保存在家中多年。

sentences.english: Grandpa leaned slowly toward Grandma and gave her a lingering kiss on her wrinkled cheek.
sentences.chinese: 老爺爺慢慢斜過身來在她的腮幫上給他一個長吻。

sentences.english: Xu master began to start investigating Zhao Chuanji and others to fine.
sentences.chinese: 徐老爺開始暗中調查趙傳奇等人的來細。

definition: son of the boss/young master of the house/your son (honorific)
girl/servant girl/(used deprecatingly, but sometimes also as a term of endearment)
daughter-in-law/wife (of a younger man)/young married woman/young woman
(coll.) father's older brother/uncle/term of respect for older man
we or us (including both the speaker and the person(s) spoken to)/(dialect) I or me/(dialect) (in a coaxing or familiar way) you/also pr. [za2 men5]
